18.m: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life. - John 3:16 (ESV)

l.q: From the Bible reading, what does it mean to be born again?
l.a: To be born again doesn't mean physical rebirth. To be born again means to be born of water and Spirit. Water immersion is basically done when John baptized Jesus and those who repented of their sins and made a profession of their faith in God. Water cleanses, just as a believer in Christ was cleansed by His blood. Those who are in Christ are indwelt or filled by the Holy Spirit, they are no longer in bondage of their sins but through the Holy Spirit are capable of doing the good works which Christ set as an example.

l.q: What did God promised to those who believe in Jesus Christ?
l.a: Those who believe in Jesus Christ will not perish but will have eternal life. They are made right with God, as Jesus died in their place for the forgiveness of their sins.

l.q: Why did God send Jesus Christ into the world?
l.a: God sent Jesus Christ into the world not to condemn the world but to save the world.

18.p: Lord God, if it were not for your son we human beings won't even have hope. We will forever be enslaved by our sins. Who has the power to set us free and save our souls, is it plain human knowledge of the Bible, or some man-made traditions? Am I truly worshipping the same God that the Bible speaks of? May you give me the grace to see the light of Christ, repent and believe that Jesus alone can grant me eternal life.
